title: Coursework Preparation: Master’s Entry to Nursing Practice (MENP) Program  |  University Center of Lake County  |  University Center Partnerships  |  Transfer Student  |  Types of Admission  |  Admission & Aid  |  DePaul University | DePaul University, Chicago
content: Transfer Student Prepare to Transfer Transferring Your Courses Meet Your Transfer Counselor DePaul Admission Partnership Program University Center PartnershipsUniversity Center at Harper CollegeUniversity Center of Lake County University Center at Harper College University Center of Lake County For Advisors Apply Online Request Info Visit Campus DePaul University>Admission & Aid>Types of Admission>Transfer Student>University Center Partnerships>University Center of Lake County>Coursework Preparation: Master’s Entry to Nursing Practice (MENP) Program Coursework Preparation: Master’s Entry to Nursing Practice (MENP) Program DePaul University and University Center of Lake County have created a partnership to provide degree programs popular at both schools to students on the University Center campus. As a Master’s Entry to Nursing Practice (MENP) program student, you should have a bachelor’s degree and have taken a few science prerequisite courses. After beginning DePaul’s cohort program, the rest of your classes will be nursing courses offered on the campus at Rosalind Franklin University of Medicine and Science site in North Chicago. View additional information Learn more Want to learn more about this program? Request more information.
